title: Wakefield 300 Returns with Record Breaking Entry List
author: Sarah Mitchell
excerpt: The highly anticipated Wakefield 300 endurance race is set to return this August with a record-breaking entry list featuring over 50 competitors from across Australia and New Zealand.
body: The highly anticipated Wakefield 300 endurance race is set to return this August with a record-breaking entry list featuring over 50 competitors from across Australia and New Zealand. This year's event promises to be the most competitive yet, with several new teams joining the grid alongside returning champions.

Event organizers have confirmed that the 2025 edition will feature enhanced safety protocols and improved spectator facilities. The iconic Wakefield Park circuit has undergone significant upgrades over the winter months, including resurfacing of key sections and installation of new safety barriers.

"We're thrilled to see such strong interest in this year's event," said Race Director John Thompson. "The quality of entries this year is exceptional, and we're expecting some fantastic racing throughout the weekend."

The event will take place over three days, featuring practice sessions, qualifying, and the main 300-kilometer endurance race. Spectators can expect to see a diverse field of vehicles, from purpose-built race cars to modified production vehicles.
Tickets are now available through the official website, with early bird pricing available until the end of July. VIP packages include pit lane access and exclusive viewing areas.

seo.metaDescription: Wakefield 300 returns with record-breaking entry list. Over 50 competitors confirmed for August's endurance race at Wakefield Park.
